subject: WMBA
name: Mgmt Challenges & Org Behav
info: Overview of ideas, theories, and concepts of organizational/management systems. Perspectives on organizations.

subject: WMBA
name: Data Analysis
fullname: Data Analysis and Reasoning in Business
info: Exploratory data analysis, basic inferential procedures, statistical process control, regression analysis.

subject: WMBA
name: Business Law
info: Origin of law; its place in, effect upon society. History/development of law. System of courts, legal procedure. Extensive study of law of contracts as basic law affecting business transactions. Law affecting sales of goods contracts.

subject: WMBA
name: Fin Acct
info: Introduction to accounting system used by firms to measure/report their economic performance, financial position, to external constituents such as stock holders, debt holders, potential investors. Basic accounting model, its strengths/shortcomings.

subject: WMBA
name: Mgr Econ
info: Basic economics principals that provide overall view of competition/cooperation in different environments. Emphasizes practical implications (i.e., ways principles can be incorporated to improve decision-making process of managers).

subject: WMBA
name: Business Ethics
info: Ethical dimension of business decision making in a market economy. Does behaving ethically mean more than behaving legally? Do managers have responsibilities to parties other than stockholders? How can managers balance potentially conflicting obligations? Is there a logical/empirical relationship between ethical behavior and profitability? Ethical dilemmas in a variety of business settings.

subject: WMBA
name: Econ Essentials for Business
info: Managerial economics, economics of public sector. Tools of economists. The market, the state.

subject: WMBA
name: Pln in Pub Sect
info: Concepts/issues in planning as a profession. Historical development of planning as a public activity, linkages to design professions and to politics. Organization/role of planning in public agencies, private organizations.

subject: WMBA
name: Mgr Acct
info: Introduction to costing systems used by firms. How cost accounting data is used by managers to make decisions about resource allocation, performance evaluation. Cost information systems for planning, decision making, control.

subject: WMBA
name: Mktg Mgmt
info: Marketing management process/activities. Marketing concepts/techniques. Implications (e.g., strategic, organizational) for business problems. Analytic/managerial processes that lead to effective marketing under various conditions.

subject: WMBA
name: Ops Mgmt
info: Operations management as a critical element of manufacturing/service organizations in global marketplace. Theory behind operation management. Current/emerging perspectives, state of the art practice. Literature, cases, video excerpts.

subject: WMBA
name: Fin Mgmt
info: Introduction to theory/practice of financial management. Valuation of securities, risk/return trade-off, capital budgeting, optimal investment decisions, cost of capital, debt/equity choices, financial planning, valuation of operating plans.

subject: WMBA
name: Logistics Mgmt
info: Business logistics as field of managerial responsibility. Linkages between logistics and marketing/operations/finance. Complexities associated with physical movement of goods. How complexities affect marketing/operations management activities, financial missions, of firm.

subject: WMBA
name: HR Mgmt
info: Role/dimensions of human resource management (HRM) in contemporary business organizations. Enhancing the contributions of employees toward the effectiveness of an organization. HRM strategies, activities, policies.

subject: WMBA
name: Strat Mgmt
info: Integrated top executive viewpoint on successful managing of business companies in a challenging environment. Frameworks for search. Analytical skills for working on projects/teams. Strategic decision-making.

subject: WMBA
name: Intl Mgmt
info: Introduction to managing international business. Multinational corporations' search for optimum solutions in adapting their strategy. Organizational/managerial arrangements to cross-border, cross-cultural, environmentally diversified activities.

subject: WMBA
name: Bus, Govt and Society
info: Applying several methods of policy analysis in a variety of real situations drawn from experience of developed market economies. Working alone or in groups, students examine case study on competition policy, trade policy, implementation of cost-benefit analysis, efficient contractor design in business. Applying analytical techniques, presentation skills. Cases, student presentations, class discussion. Seminar.

subject: WMBA
name: Mgmt Info Sys
info: How information management operates. How a new information system is designed/delivered. Issues connected with Information technology/systems use in the organization.

subject: WMBA
name: Decision Sci
info: Barriers in business-type decision making processes. Emphasizes different forms of decision making, different methods of overcoming barriers. Managing practical difficulties. Concepts of decision making theory, mechanisms underlying decision making processes. Techniques, computerized tools for supporting decision making. Students participate in group decision making.

subject: WMBA
name: Intl Envir
info: Introduction to international trade/finance theory, political economy of international trade policy, institutional governance of international trade/monetary policy. Differences in countries' political-economic, sociocultural systems. Implications for managerial decision making.

subject: WMBA
name: Cost Ben Analysis
info: Methods/techniques of cost-benefit analysis in real situations drawn from experience of post-communist economies. Presentation in two parts: developing economies, developed economies.

subject: WMBA
name: Field Prj
info: Personal involvement, practical teamwork. Students define problem; gather, analyze, evaluate data; develop managerial recommendations; prepare/present report.

subject: WMBA
name: Strat Chgs in Global Context
fullname: Implementing Strategic Changes in a Global Context
info: Processes for introducing major strategic changes. Focuses on restructuring, realignment, and redirection driven by globalization, formation of EU, and transition from planned economy to market.

subject: WMBA
name: Macro Environment of Bus
info: Determinants of national income or GDP, national income accounting, money market equilibrium, trade off between inflation/unemployment, roots of income disparities between nations.

subject: WMBA
name: Mgmt Skills
info: Frameworks from social sciences that are useful for understanding organizational processes. Applying frameworks to particular situations.

subject: WMBA
name: Project Finance
info: Financing large investment projects such as infrastructure investments. Evaluating project, preparing feasibility study, analyzing project sensitivity to variables. Determining capital structure and management form.

subject: WMBA
name: Business Ethics
info: Ethical dimension of business decision making in a market economy. Does behaving ethically mean more than behaving legally? Do managers have responsibilities to parties other than stockholders? How can managers balance potentially conflicting obligations? Is there a logical/empirical relationship between ethical behavior and profitability? Ethical dilemmas in a variety of business settings.

subject: WMBA
name: Policy Analysis
info: Students apply several methods of policy analysis in real situations drawn from experience of developed market economies. Students examine case studies on competition policy, trade policy, implementation of cost-benefit analysis, and efficient contract design in business. Analysis in context, strengths/weaknesses of various analytical techniques/approaches. Seminar. Cases form basis for student presentations/discussion.

subject: WMBA
name: Mgmt Challenges
info: Overview of ideas, theories, and concepts of complex/hybrid organizational/management systems. Perspectives on organizations.

subject: WMBA
name: Change Management
info: Overview of theories in managing change.

subject: WMBA
name: Web 2.0: Blogs, Wikis, Soc Net
fullname: Web 2.0: The Business of Blogs, Wikis, and Online Social Networks
info: Business of using social computing technologies. Readings, discussion, and case analysis.prereq: Warsaw Executive MBA students only

subject: WMBA
name: Mgmt Challenges & Org Behavior
info: Ideas, theories, and concepts for organizations and management systems in global/networked economy. Comtemporary mega-trends, their business consequences. Complexity/change, crisis in principles of industrial revolution, management for connected economy, virtual organizations, human side of virtual enterprises.

subject: WMBA
name: Human Resources Mgmt
info: Human resources issues from managerial perspective. External environment in which firm operates, characteristics of its workforce. The firm's developed culture. Strategy of the organization, technology of production, organization of work. Framework for managing human resources strategically.

subject: WMBA
name: Economic Essentials for Bus
info: Managerial economics, economics of public sector. Some concepts of economics. Tools of an economist, the market, the state.

subject: WMBA
name: Managerial Economics
info: Tools, economics principles that provide overview of competition/cooperation in different environments. Emphasizes practical implications of principles.

subject: WMBA
name: Business Law
info: Terms/conditions of commencing/conducting business in Poland. Concepts for entrepreneurs: national court register, enterprise, business name, commercial power of attorney. Corpoarte law, problems regarding bankruptcy/arrangement Law. Concepts of banking/insurance law.

subject: WMBA
name: Data Analysis & Reasoning
info: Exploratory data analysis, inferential procedures, regression analysis, and time series analysis in a business setting. Overview of graphical/numerical methods for summarizing data. Use of inferential statistics. Focuses on sampling distribution of a statistic.

subject: WMBA
name: Financial Accounting
info: Introduction to accounting system used by firms to measure/report their economic performance and financial position to external constituents, such as stockholders, creditors, and potential investors. Basic accounting model, its strengths/shortcomings.

subject: WMBA
name: Managerial Accounting
info: Management accounting information system that produces outputs, using inputs. Processes to satisy specific management objectives. How accounting can help managers identify/solve problems and evaluate performance.

subject: WMBA
name: Financial Management
info: Essentials of financial management theory/practice. Time value of money, valuation of bonds/stocks, risk/return turn-off, capital budgeting, optimal investment decisions, financial analysis/planning, cost of capital, debt/equity choices, firm valuation, mergers/acquisitions.

subject: WMBA
name: Strat Marketing Mgmt
info: Marketing concepts/analysis, strategy/planning in different market conditions. Lectures, readings, case discussions, computer simulation.

subject: WMBA
name: Ops & Logistics Mgmt
info: Operations/business logistics as field of managerial responsibility. Linkages between logistics, operations, and other managerial disciplines, such as marketing and finance.

subject: WMBA
name: Managing in Intl Environ
info: Policies to balance constraints produced by globalization and regional economic integration, in order to reduce transaction costs for business/public.

subject: WMBA
name: Macroeconomic Business Environ
info: Students apply methods of decision-making, and of business/public policy analysis, in various real situations drawn from experience of developed market economies.

subject: WMBA
name: Business Ethics
info: Ethical dimension of business decision-making in a market economy. Does behaving ethically mean more than behaving legally? Do managers have responsibilities to parties other than stockholders? How can managers balance potentially conflicting obligations? Is there a logical relationship between ethical behavior and profitability? Ethical dilemmas in various business settings.

subject: WMBA
name: Strategic Management
info: Integrated top-executive point of view on successful managing of diverse businesses in a challenging game with competitors. Analytical skills, creative synthesis of diverse factors, individual/team work, informatin search, problems formulation. Decision making under conditions of time presssure, uncertainty, ambiguity, and risk.

subject: WMBA
name: Management Info Systems
info: Information techonology/systems. Data flow diagrams, data modeling, electronic commerce, HTML, Web design, ERP systems, database management systems, business process re-engineering.

subject: WMBA
name: Effective Decisions
info: Identifying barriers to effective decision making in business. Different forms of decision making. Methods of overcoming barriers and managing practical difficulties.

subject: WMBA
name: Concentration
info: Students take at least three electives: one of limited choice and two of free choice. List of options changes yearly.

subject: WMBA
name: Concentration
info: Students take at least three electives: one of limited choice and two of free choice. List of options changes yearly.

subject: WMBA
name: Concentration
info: Students take at least three electives: one of limited choice and two of free choice. List of options changes yearly.

subject: WMBA
name: Field Project
info: Students define problem; gather, analyze, and evaluate data; develop managerial recommendations; and prepare/present a report.

subject: WMBA
name: Managing Prj Ops
info: Issues/concepts related to managing projects in organizations. Project planning/organization, budgeting/control, project life cycles, organization of workflow, project planning elements. Organizational forms, conflict resolution, leadership/task management in project environment. Project scheduling: WBS, CPM, PERT, simulation, resource constrained scheduling.

subject: WMBA
name: AOSM
fullname: Action-oriented Strategy Mapping (or What to Do When Thinking Matters)
info: AOSM technique for linking stategic thinking, acting, and learning. Helping make sense of complex problems and communicating to oneself/others what might be done about them.

subject: WMBA
name: Strategic Brand Management
info: Warsaw Executive MBA: Strategic Brand Management

subject: WMBA
name: Manager's Self-Development
info: Concentration course for Warsaw Executive MBA students.

subject: WMBA
name: Power of Human Capital
fullname: Quality and Productivity in Practice: The Power of Human Capital
info: Course taken in Warsaw for Carlson School of Management's Warsaw Executive MBA program.

subject: WMBA
name: WEMBA Substitute Class
info: For WEMBA students completing credits after end of official program. Majority of courses completed through Canadian Executive MBA program.

subject: WMBA
name: WEMBA Substitute Class
info: For WEMBA students completing credits after end of official program. Majority of courses completed through Canadian Executive MBA program.

subject: WMBA
name: WEMBA Substitute Class
info: For WEMBA students completing credits after end of official program. Majority of courses completed through Canadian Executive MBA program.

subject: WMBA
name: WEMBA Substitute Class
info: For WEMBA students completing credits after end of official program. Majority of courses completed through Canadian Executive MBA program.

subject: WMBA
name: International Residency
info: Perspective on U.S./international business practices. Global business strategy coursework, corporate site visits.

subject: WMBA
name: Enterprising Entrepreneurship
fullname: Enterprising Entrepreneurship from IDEA to IPO
info: Enterprising entrepreneurship from IDEA to IPO.

subject: WMBA
name: Developing Business
info: Entrepreneurship as a business phenomenon, whether as a corporate or independent venture or as an alliance. How to apply knowledge to new-business development process.

subject: WMBA
name: Corporate Restructuring
info: Corporate restructuring for value.

subject: WMBA
name: Financial Risk Management
info: Financial risk mangagement. Ways for a firm to reduce risk.

subject: WMBA
name: Technology Marketing
info: Marketing/management side of technology. Strategic decision problems in technology marketing/management. How to address these decision problems. Technology trends, drivers shaping the economy.

subject: WMBA
name: Developing Management Skills
info: n/a

subject: WMBA
name: Manager's Development Path
info: Warsaw Executive MBA elective course.
